name: df-rqp
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(crqp, cmpt(s0, cprime, cin(ceqp, csb(s3, crab(s1, co(cz, cmap, cz), wrex(s2, crn(cuz), wss(cima(ccnv(cv(s1)), cdif(cz, csn(nat0))), cv(s2)))), cxp(cv(s3), cin(cv(s3), co(cz, cmap, co(nat0, cfz, co(cv(s0), cmin, nat1)))))))))
comment: There is a unique element of ` ( ZZ ^m ( 0 ... ( p - 1 ) ) ) ` ` ~Qp ` -equivalent to any element of ` ( ZZ ^m ZZ ) ` , if the sequences are zero for sufficiently large negative values; this function selects that element. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Dec-2014.)
